AccessSystem.Architecture

Class Campus

  • java.lang.Object
    • AccessSystem.Architecture.Campus
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Subject, java.io.Serializable

    public class Campus
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, Subject

    Campus Class: Architecture Hierarchy

    Creates a Campus that holds a list of buildings, used as part of the architecture chain. Instances of the campus class are created through the architecture factory.

    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Campus(java.lang.String campusName, AccessLogger accessLogger, EmergencyLogger emergencyLogger)
      Default Constructor: Instantiates campusBuildings as a new ArrayList, Requires the campus name on creation.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Campus

        public Campus(java.lang.String campusName,
              AccessLogger accessLogger,
              EmergencyLogger emergencyLogger)
        Default Constructor: Instantiates campusBuildings as a new ArrayList, Requires the campus name on creation. Passes in the current accessLogger and emergencyLogger for the university.
        Parameters:
        campusName - The name of the campus
        accessLogger - The current accessLogger for the universtiy.
        emergencyLogger - The current emergencyLogger for the universtiy.
